bug.author: yaroslavvb
bug.description:
Here's what I see in wandb: <denchmark-link:https://app.wandb.ai/yaroslavvb/imagenet18/runs/beiwi3l0/logs>https://app.wandb.ai/yaroslavvb/imagenet18/runs/beiwi3l0/logs</denchmark-link>
Here's what I see on my screen <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/yaroslavvb/1c8927a162de0c95a313ef68866c8212>https://gist.github.com/yaroslavvb/1c8927a162de0c95a313ef68866c8212</denchmark-link>
Here's wandb debug.log <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/yaroslavvb/fec321dbe04f1ed955fc123a2e6b434b>https://gist.github.com/yaroslavvb/fec321dbe04f1ed955fc123a2e6b434b</denchmark-link>
The run crashed but the line that gave the reason for crash ("Missing or unavailable event queue") didn't make it into wandb

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.92. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

This was configuration error on my end. The error was logged by a child process which didn't have access to WANDB_API_KEY. AWS EFA requires launching through mpirun. Unlike pytorch distributed launcher which copies local environment for children, mpirun requires specifying env vars to propagate. So the solution was to do mpirun -x WANDB_API_KEY=$WANDB_API_KEY ... python myscript.py
